title: Portrait of a Lady
provenance_text:
Collection of Mrs. Albert J. Barr, left for storage at Carnegie Museum of Art between 1918 and 1920 [1]. 
Classified as loan on February 2, 1956. 
Appropriated by the museum of art committee on June 11, 1978 [2]. 

NOTES:
1. Information from acquisitions card found in curatorial file. Reads: "Permission granted Mrs. Barr, 1918, send 10 ptgs. on deposit to be entirely at her risk. In Nov '18 word came 4 withdrawn, Gillespie would deliver others. Arrived December, 1918. Dec. '19 asked Mrs. B remove, neede dspace due resumption Int. Jan. '20 found above ptg., wrote Mrs. B. Gill. had evidently delivered  7 instead of 6. Said wd. hold pending orders from her. She replied glad could hold pending arrangements, as had had difficulting getting man to collect others. There correspondence re this seems to end. (See 1603 in C.I. files, 1918-1920). Mrs. Barr's daughter married Wm. S. Moorehead, borther of Mr. Bovard's mother, and trustee of C.I. at his death. Mrs. Moorhead also deceased. Painting classified as a loan 2/17/56. See memorandum to Mr. Arkus from Miss Stolzenbach, February 2, 1956. 

2. See minutes of Museum of Art Committee meeting on June 11, 1978.
TBF 10/28/2014

creator.death_place: Trenton Falls (Oneida county, New York state, United States)
